page.title: 01Pebworth & District
page.content: The villages of Pebworth and Long Marston and hamlet of Broad Marston lie on the borders of the 3 counties of Worcester, Warwick and Gloucester. Since l932 Pebworth and Broad Marston have been administered by Worcester County Council but Gloucester County Council still owns houses, farms and considerable land. Long Marston is administered by Warwick County Council. The settlements lie between Evesham and Stratford, south of the River Avon. The gently undulating land is intensively farmed. The Army Engineers Store Depot, built in l940, lies on the western border. There are no major roads but a railway line, serving the camp and a scrap metal firm passes north west to south. The population, approximately l,000, will remain stable as development is prohibited for the next eight years.
